protocols.Paper_title: Evaluation of recombinant baculovirus clearance during rAAV production in Sf9 cells using a newly developed fluorescent-TCID50 assay
Provenance: p1 Results/Discussion: baculovirus removal/inactivation steps include sodium lauryl sulfate (Sarkosyl/SLS) and Triton X-100 lysis; CsCl ultracentrifugation; NFR filtration.
p3 Fig 1: clarification step includes Sf9 cell lysis with 1% Sarkosyl and 1% Triton X-100.
p6 Sec 3.4 and p7: QPCR analysis used (AAV recovery after NFR filtration determined by QPCR).

protocols.Paper_title: Evaluation of recombinant baculovirus clearance during rAAV production in Sf9 cells using a newly developed fluorescent-TCID50 assay
Provenance: p2 Sec 2.2: rBV-GFP generation includes removal of cell pellets by centrifugation and concentration by ultracentrifugation with sucrose gradient.

protocols.Paper_title: Evaluation of recombinant baculovirus clearance during rAAV production in Sf9 cells using a newly developed fluorescent-TCID50 assay
Provenance: p6 Sec 3.3: assessment of rBV inactivation by 1% SLS (Sarkosyl) and/or 1% Triton X-100 (detergent treatment/lysis context).
p3 Table 1 footnote: processed lysate generated by lysis buffer containing both SLS and Triton X-100.

protocols.Paper_title: Evaluation of recombinant baculovirus clearance during rAAV production in Sf9 cells using a newly developed fluorescent-TCID50 assay
Provenance: p4 Sec 2.6: buffer exchange using Amicon-4 centrifugal filter units involves spinning (centrifugal concentration).

protocols.Paper_title: Evaluation of recombinant baculovirus clearance during rAAV production in Sf9 cells using a newly developed fluorescent-TCID50 assay
